title.narrative: EXPANDING SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH SERVICES IN BURUNDI, PHASE II

description.narrative: Phase II employs a four-pronged approach to drive demand for, increase access to, and create an enabling environment for high-quality SRH information, products, and services, particularly among youth. This approach consists of (1) evidence-based SBCC, (2) delivery of high-quality SRH services, (3) distribution of a wide range of contraceptive methods, and (4) community engagement to break down the systematic barriers individuals face to accessing these SRH products and services. The programme’s objective is to increase Burundi’s CPR through expanding the delivery of highquality SRH products and services to WRA and youth in particular. With support from the EKN, PSI/Burundi continues to address the challenges in Burundi by offering high-quality products, services, and information necessary to improve the SRH of WRA, including youth, in Burundi. PSI/Burundi contribute to EKN's four result areas: - EKN Result Area 1: Young people are better informed and are thus able to make healthier choices regarding their sexuality - EKN Result Area 2: A growing number of people have access to anti-retroviral drugs, contraceptives and other commodities required for good SRH - EKN Result Area 3: Public and private clinics provide better sexual and reproductive healthcare services, which more and more people are using - EKN Result Area 4: Greater respect for the sexual and reproductive rights of people to whom these rights are denied

provider-org.narrative: Embassy of the Kingdom of Neederland, Burundi

title.narrative: Tunza logical Framework January to March 2021
Tunza annual Report 2019
TUNZA-LOGICAL-FRAMEWORK-APRIL-TO-JUNE-2020---FINAL-VERSION-AFTER-PMT-20200824080816.xlsx
Number of new Family Planning (FP) users at Tunza Clinics

description.narrative: A growing number of people have access contraceptives and other commodities required for good sexual and reproductive health. Number of new FP users refers to the number of persons who accept for the first time in their lives any (program) contraceptive method; to be reported for a defined reference period (e.g., one year).

title.narrative: Number of new FP users refers to the number of client who accept for the first time a contraceptive method

comment.narrative: For male and female for Phase I (2013-2018)

During Q4, we exceeded our annual target. This was mostly due to activities conducted during holidays where we intensified BCC activities around each clinics called "Tunza Days" coupled with the use of vouchers. We continued with the Education Through Listening approach, and the new "Tableau à Poche" which helps the IPC agents to have a beneficiaries centered and more focused sensitizations responding to the beneficiaries needs.
Our 4 year target is 37904 new users. By the end of the 1st quarter of 2019 we were at 32617 new FP users. We will exceed this indicator in the days to come
2017 Annual Target

Through a newly approach startegy for sensitizing women called "Education Through Listening", the focus has been on addressing rumors and myths around SRHR. IPC agents also use this strategy to target new FP adopters.

We are at 66,5 % of the target with 50% of time elapsed. With the Education Through Listening approach, we introduced the new "Tableau à Poche" which helps the IPC agents to have more information on the audience and with confidentiality (whether they are on methods or not, their perception of contraceptive methods). This allows the IPC agents to share a more focused information responding to the beneficiaries needs.
2018 Annual Target
We continued the Education Through Listening approach which is really showing some nice impact to find new adherence

title.narrative: Number of CYPs (couple-year of protection) provided

description.narrative: In family planning, the number of days per year that any birth control method will prevent a pregnancy . Abstaning from sexual intercourse, or sterilization of both couples, provide absolute (365 days/year) protection. Other family planning methods or fertility inhibition are relatively less effective.

title.narrative: Number of CYPs provided

comment.narrative: This is the baseline after 3 years of the project (2013-2016): Phase I of the project
This is the 2018 Annual Target
We are at 15,4% to the target while the time elapsed is 25%.This is the usual tends with the beggining of the year where beneficiaries are not financially confortable which impact on their behavior.
We are at 32,8% of the annual target with 25% time elapsed.

We are at 36% while the time elapsed is 50%. This is mainly due to condoms sales that are behind. It is during Q3 and Q4 of the year that we see a high demand for condoms and where we increase our marketing and BCC activities.

We developed a Marketing strategies for condoms which was about the wholesalers competition( from August to November) pair with blitz promo and sale to destock wholesalers. We added discount for those who will purchase more condoms. This tripled our sales during this period. The sales of other contraceptives has also increased as a result of the intensified BCC/IPC activities around each clinics called "Tunza Days" coupled with a slight cost reduction. Note that these activities were conducted during holidays
This is the target for 2017 only
We reached 98,7% of the annual CYP target

title.narrative: Number of WRA (Women of reproductive age) received at Tunza clinics for a contraceptive method

comment.narrative: Baseline from Phase I (2013-2016)
We are at 35% of the target with 25% time elapsed.
We are in good progress with this indicator as we are at 57% from the annual target with 50% time elapsed.
We are in good progress with this indicator as we are at 94% of the target with 75% of time elapse.
Target for 2017

title.narrative: Number of clients screened and treated for Sexual Transmitted Deseases (STDs)

description.narrative: STDs often have few or no symptoms, syndromic diagnoses is the method used in Burundi to find out if you are infected ; Many STDs are easily treated, but if left untreated may become painful or cause long term effect

title.narrative: Number of clients screened and treated for STDs

comment.narrative: The target of the project was to diagnose and treat 10,000 people for STI. At the end of the first quarter of 2019, we are 14,239 beneficiaries received and treated.The target has been exceeded and services continue to be offered.
We are planning to review (increase) our annual target.

We have already exceeded the annual target. This is due to the fact that we calculated 4 year target based to 2016 data while we were starting to work in 3 new provinces with the lowest CPR and a high risk behavior. We therefore exceeded our 4 year target and continue to offer services and sensitize as well.

We have already exceeded the annual target. This is due to the fact that we calculated 4 year target based to 2016 data while we were starting to work in 3 new provinces with the lowest CPR and a high risk behavior. We therefore exceeded our 4 year target and continue to offer services and sensitize as well.

title.narrative: Number of clients tested for HIV and receive their test results

description.narrative: The only way to know for sure whether you have HIV is to get tested. Knowing your HIV status gives you powerful information to help you take steps to keep you and your partner healthy. Beside its main mission to offer contraceptive methods, Tunza Clinics offer HIV screening service to women and men as an integrated SRH service.

title.narrative: Number of clients tested for HIV and receive their test results

comment.narrative: Of the 3163 people who were tested and received their results, 3% were HIV-positive and were referred to the nearest treatment centers
The 4 year annual target was 10,000 beneficiairies . By the end of Q1 2019, we are at 15,934 beneficiaries.

We have exceeded the annual target. We calculated 4 year target using 2016 data. As we introduced new clinics in 3 more provinces with the lowest CPR and a higher risk behavior, this resulted in a urge increase of demand as we were progressing with sensitizations.
We are planning to review the annual target of this indicator

title.narrative: Number of clients received for Post Abortion Care services

description.narrative: Total number of clients received for Post Abortion Care (PAC) services and received Misoprostol or/ and Manual Vacuum Aspiration procedure

title.narrative: Total number of clients received for Post Abortion Care services in 2017

comment.narrative: The program started to offer PAC services in May 2016
223 clients were received for Post Abortion Care services in 2017
There is an increase in demand for this PAC services compared to 2018 (1st quarter). The service is starting to be known in the community.

We do not have a target according to this indicator. This is mostly due to the fact that is really challenging to communicate around PAC services in Burundi context. However targets exist for the number of Miso to be used.

We do not have a target according to this indicator. This is mostly due to the fact that is really challenging to communicate around PAC services in Burundi context. However targets exist for the number of Miso to be used.

title.narrative: Number of unintended pregnancies averted

description.narrative: Unintended pregnancies are pregnancies that are mistimed, unplanned or unwanted at the time of conception. Unintended pregnancies may also result from rape, incest or various other forms of forced or unwanted sex. Vaginal sexual activity without the use of contraception through choice or coercion is the predominant cause of unintended pregnancy. The incorrect use of a contraceptive method, and failure of the method chosen also contributing. Available contraception methods include use of birth control pills, a condom, intrauterine device (IUD, IUC, IUS), contraceptive implant , ....sterilization. Unintended pregnancies may be unwanted pregnancies or mistimed pregnancies

title.narrative: Number of unintended pregnancies averted

description.narrative: Unintended pregnancies are pregnancies that are mistimed, unplanned or unwanted at the time of conception. Unintended pregnancies may also result from rape, incest or various other forms of forced or unwanted sex. Vaginal sexual activity without the use of contraception through choice or coercion is the predominant cause of unintended pregnancy. The incorrect use of a contraceptive method, and failure of the method chosen also contributing. Available contraception methods include use of birth control pills, a condom, intrauterine device (IUD, IUC, IUS), contraceptive implant , ....sterilization. Unintended pregnancies may be unwanted pregnancies or mistimed pregnancies

comment.narrative: We are at 84% with 75% of time elapsed.Key awareness and promotional activities were conducted during this quarter, taking advantage of the vacation period. These were the Tunza Days (Awareness coupled with the use of vouchers) + competition wholesalers and blitz sales / promo for prudence class and strengthening the Education through Listening approach as well as the Counseling for continuation
We are on track with this indicator, at 28,2% of the annual target.

title.narrative: Number of Misoprostol used for Post Abortion Care services

Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin which can be used to prevent stomach ulcers associated with NSAID use and also used for its aptitude for causing uterine contractions which empties the uterus.

comment.narrative: PAC services were integrated in may 2016
We are at 17% with 25 % time elapsed. We are working on expending the number of clinics that offer PAC services and go from 7 to 19.

We are at 40% of the target with 50% of time elapsed. After introducing PAC services in 12 more clinics, we are working on the sensitization in order to inform the community on the availability of that service in those clinics.
We are at 56% of the annual target with 75% of the time elapsed. it was difficult for new clinics that are offering PAC services to be known as such. But it is now starting.
We are very much behind with this indicator. We will work on making known PAC services as much as possible in the community .

title.narrative: Number of youth (15-24) who receive a contraceptive method in Tunza clinics
Number of youth (15-24) who receive a contraceptive method in Tunza clinics

comment.narrative: Phase I baseline (2013-2016)

As the main focus of the project is youth, we increased activities targeting youth, reinforced the number of IPC agents and they skills in IPC (using ETL as well). In addition to that we trained all providers on youth- friendly services. This recommandation came from the Marketing Insight study were youth explained that they will go at any Tunza clinic not only the ones with youth space and that they sometimes face judgmental attitude from providers. This is why we are seing a considerable increase of uptake among youth during this second phase of the project.

As the main focus of the project is youth, we increased activities targeting youth, reinforced the number of IPC agents and they skills in IPC (using ETL as well). In addition to that we trained all providers on youth- friendly services. This recommandation came from the Marketing Insight study were youth explained that they will go at any Tunza clinic not only the ones with youth space and that they sometimes face judgmental attitude from providers. This is why we are seing a considerable increase of uptake among youth during this second phase of the project.

The 4 year target was to reach 20,000 youth beneficiaries who receive contraceptives methods. By the 1st quarter of 2019, we are at 29,418 youth received in Tunza clinics for FP methods. This year we will be focusing more on young people aged from 15 to 19 in order to contribute on avoiding early pregnancies.
This high numbers is a result of increased clinics and availability of youth friendly health services in all the private franchised clinics
